fields.title: Fragments of the Digests of Justinian, Book 37, Titles 7-9
fields.tei_xml:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<TEI xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
  <teiHeader>
    <fileDesc>
      <titleStmt>
        <title>Description of Ms. Codex 1223 - Fragments of the Digests of Justinian, Book 37, Titles 7-9 (1400-1499)</title>
      </titleStmt>
      <publicationStmt>
        <publisher>Schoenberg Center for Electronic Text and Image, University of Pennsylvania</publisher>
        <availability>
          <licence target="http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/legalcode">
                            This work and all referenced images are ©2014 University of Pennsylvania. They are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License (CC BY-NC 4.0), http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/.
                          </licence>
        </availability>
      </publicationStmt>
      <sourceDesc>
        <msDesc>
          <msIdentifier>
            <settlement>Philadelphia</settlement>
            <institution>University of Pennsylvania</institution>
            <repository>Rare Book & Manuscript Library</repository>
            <idno>Ms. Codex 1223</idno>
          </msIdentifier>
          <msContents>
            <summary>Bifolium with fragments from Book 37 of the Digests of Justinian I (Byzantine emperor, 527-565), containing (in order) sections of Title 7 on dowries, Title 9 on inheritance, and Title 8 on the children of marriages in which one partner is an emancipated slave. The text is surrounded by 15th-century commentary on the laws.</summary>
            <textLang>Latin</textLang>
            <msItem>
              <title>Fragments of the Digests of Justinian, Book 37, Titles 7-9</title>
            </msItem>
          </msContents>
          <physDesc>
            <decoDesc>
              <decoNote n="1v">Puzzle initial, Initial S, f. 1v</decoNote>
            </decoDesc>
          </physDesc>
          <history>
            <origin>
              <origDate>1400-1499</origDate>
              <origPlace>France?</origPlace>
            </origin>
          </history>
        </msDesc>
      </sourceDesc>
    </fileDesc>
  </teiHeader>
